EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5)

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research, now operating with updated electrical connectivity.
• Electricity Groups – originally configured with poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5), (x=1.5, y=22.5) plus additional ones at (x=-10.5, y=18.5), (x=-11.5, y=18.5), (x=-12.5, y=16.5); recent updates show reconfigured groups (e.g. with poles at (x=-0.5, y=17.5), (x=1.5, y=16.5), (x=1.5, y=24.5), (x=8.5, y=7.5), (x=-17.5, y=16.5), etc.).
• Steam Engines – primary engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5) and additional engines at (x=-14.5, y=13.5), (x=7.5, y=35.5), (x=8.5, y=20.5).
• Fluid System Submodule – Boiler Module comprising:
 – Pre-existing Boiler at (x=-13.5, y=19.0) with an intermediate connection originally at (x=-17.5, y=21.5) (connection failed).
 – A repositioned Boiler+Steam Engine Pair with the boiler at (x=-10.0, y=22.5) and steam engine at (x=-7.5, y=11.5) (connection unresolved).
 – An additional attempted Boiler+Steam Engine Pair with the boiler at (x=-7.0, y=23.5) and steam engine at (x=1.5, y=28.5) (pipe connection unresolved).
 – A successfully connected Boiler+Steam Engine Pair with the boiler at (x=-2.0, y=15.5) and steam engine at (x=11.5, y=13.5) via PipeGroup (fluid_system=151295).
 – New unresolved pipe groups observed near (x=-8.5, y=20.5) and (x=-2.5, y=21.5) indicating further fluid layout adjustments.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) reconfigured for iron gear wheel production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5).
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5).
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5).
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
• Belt Source Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=25.5).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction Source: Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=5.5, y=15.5).
• A manual Transport Belt Chain composed of horizontal and vertical segments.
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) with pickup at (x=8.5, y=10.5) and drop at (x=8.5, y=8.5).
• Belt Chain Burner Inserter Refueling Subsystem with multiple burner inserters.

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (x=-30.5, y=37.5) (WORKING).
• Boiler for fluid heating at (x=-29.0, y=33.5).
• Pipe Connection via a PipeGroup now updated (e.g. fluid_system=153933) at (x=-30.5, y=31.5) carrying water with status FULL_OUTPUT.
• A segmented pipe connection attempt aimed at linking the Offshore Pump with the New Boiler (targeted near x=-10.0, y=22.5) remains unresolved.

### Expanded Smelting Zone (new)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace at (x=-20.0, y=22.0) placed successfully.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-20.0, y=25.0) placed successfully.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-17.0, y=25.0) placed successfully.
• An intended Stone Furnace at (x=-17.0, y=22.0) that could not be placed due to a persistent blocking PipeGroup at (x=-17.5, y=21.5) (logged with fluid_system identifiers 152840/152999).

────────────────────────
New Network Structures
────────────────────────
### Long-distance Transport Belt Network at approximate span (input near x=-3.5, y=10.5; output near x=22.5, y=10.5)
Consists of:
• A Belt Group with input Belt at (x=-3.5, y=10.5) (direction RIGHT) and output Belt at (x=22.5, y=10.5) (direction DOWN) comprising 29 belts.
Use-case: Facilitates long‐range material transfer between distant factory zones.

### Copper Ore Transport Line at approximate region (x≈8–9, y≈11–15)
Consists of:
• A Belt Group with inputs: Belt at (x=8.5, y=11.5) (direction DOWN) and Belt at (x=7.5, y=15.5) (direction RIGHT), and output: Belt at (x=8.5, y=15.5) (direction RIGHT), comprising 6 belts and carrying copper-ore.
Use-case: Transports copper ore over short distances.

### Integrated Auxiliary Transport Network at approximate center (x≈3, y≈16)
Consists of:
• A Belt Group with inputs: Belt at (x=2.5, y=13.5) (direction RIGHT), Belt at (x=2.5, y=15.5) (direction LEFT), and Belt at (x=5.5, y=18.5) (direction UP) comprising 23 belts.
• A connected Belt Group with inputs: Belt at (x=3.5, y=16.5) (direction RIGHT), Belt at (x=2.5, y=25.5) (direction RIGHT), and Belt at (x=4.5, y=28.5) (direction UP) with outputs: Belt at (x=3.5, y=16.5) (direction RIGHT) and Belt at (x=4.5, y=16.5) (direction LEFT) comprising 16 belts.
Use-case: Provides intermediate material transport within localized production areas.

### Short Belt Connector A at approximate location (x≈-0.5 to -1.5, y≈20.5)
Consists of:
• A Belt Group with input: Belt at (x=-0.5, y=20.5) (direction LEFT) and output: Belt at (x=-1.5, y=20.5) (direction LEFT) comprising 2 belts.
Use-case: Links adjacent factory sections with a minimal belt segment.

### Short Belt Connector B at approximate location (x≈-4.5 to -5.5 and nearby segments)
Consists of:
• A Belt Group with input: Belt at (x=-4.5, y=25.5) (direction LEFT) and output: Belt at (x=-5.5, y=25.5) (direction LEFT) comprising 2 belts.
• Additional belt segments at (x=-2.5, y=26.5) (direction RIGHT) and (x=-1.5, y=27.5) (direction RIGHT).
Use-case: Augments local belt connectivity in the higher-y production zone.

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Inventory and Material Supply:
 – Ensure sufficient raw resources and proper fuel supplies are available before initiating smelting or assembly to avoid low output.
• Placement and Obstruction Avoidance:
 – Verify that target build positions are unobstructed and free of non‐removable entities (such as persistent PipeGroups) before placement.
• Fluid System Connectivity:
 – Validate pipe group configurations and interconnections to resolve unresolved links between boilers, steam engines, and remote systems.
• Electrical Network Stability:
 – Monitor reconfigured electricity pole placements to ensure continuous power distribution across integrated systems.
• Belt Network Integrity:
 – Confirm that extended belt segments are correctly aligned and connected to maintain uninterrupted material flow.
